conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are designed to redirect the flow of the liquid, and the containers (D and E) are positioned at the ends of the baffles.
Baffle A is directed towards Container D.
Baffle B is directed towards Container E.
Baffle C is directed towards Container E.

premise: Baffle A is directed towards Container D.
conclusion: Any liquid that flows through Baffle A will eventually flow into Container D.

premise: Baffle B is directed towards Container E.
conclusion: Any liquid that flows through Baffle B will eventually flow into Container E.

premise: Baffle C is directed towards Container E.
conclusion: Any liquid that flows through Baffle C will eventually flow into Container E.

premise: Liquid flowing through Baffle A will go into Container D. Liquid flowing through Baffles B and C will go into Container E.
conclusion: Liquid from A will flow into Container D. Liquid from B and C will flow into Container E.
